question: Which of the following Indian rulers gave 500 elephants to Seleucus Nicator?
explanation: Seleucus Nicator served as the Infantry general of Alexander. After his death he succeeded in gaining control over the territory which Alexander had conquered in Asia. Chandragupta defeated him around 301 BCE and was compelled to yield Arachosia, Gedrosia, and Parapomisadai to him in return for 500 elephants.
